snippet: Federal officials will determine whether comments suggesting that there would be budget cuts if Republicans keep control of Congress constituted political pressure to vote for Democrats.
abstract: Office of Special Counsel is investigating whether remarks by senior Federal Aviation Administration official John Hickey, who told subordinates there will be budget cuts that could lead to furloughs if Republicans keep control of Congress, constitute political pressure to vote for Democrats.
lead_paragraph: Federal officials will determine whether comments suggesting that there would be budget cuts if Republicans keep control of Congress constituted political pressure to vote for Democrats.

headline.seo: F.A.A. Officer in Inquiry Over Remark Seen as Partisan
headline.main: Inquiry Starts at F.A.A. Over Remark on Budget
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Starts At F.A.A. Over Remark On Budget

keywords.value: United States Office of Special Counsel
keywords.name: organizations
